text: Donald Ray Fritts (November 8, 1942 â€“ August 27, 2019) was an American session musician and songwriter. In 2008, he was added into the Alabama Music Hall of Fame. He was known for working with Kris Kristofferson. Working closely with Rick Hall, Billy Sherrill, Dan Penn, Arthur Alexander, David Briggs, Jerry Carrigan and Norbert Putnam. In 2014, he appeared on Country Funk Vol. II, a compilation album from Light in the Attic. In 2015, he signed with Single Lock Records. Fritts died from heart surgery-related problems on August 27, 2019, at a hospital in Birmingham, Alabama at the age of 76. ==References== ==Other websites== * *Donnie Fritts Interview - NAMM Oral History Library (2015) * * Category:1942 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:American keyboardists Category:American songwriters Category:Musicians from Alabama Category:Writers from Alabama Category:People from Florence, Alabama
title: Donnie Fritts
